title: Emmanuel Macron's U-turn on protests adds to France's deficit pain
text:
Chaotic protests, deficit headaches and a divisive politician under intense pressure. But for once we’re not talking about Brexit Britain or Extinction Rebellion: take a look across the Channel instead.

The relentless focus on the UK’s interminable withdrawal from the EU means that many will have missed what a dire state the French public finances are in. President Emmanuel Macron swept to power in 2017 with “Jupiterian” ambitions to transform France’s sclerotic economy. Predictably, though, the main Jupiterian aspect of its recent draft budget is the size of the reverse-ferret on said reforms.
